conbody.p: This section describes the aerospike sub-chart parameters in the SPS Helm chart.

section.title: Namespaces
section.p: The Aerospike parameters are related to the following namespaces:
This is the default namespace for the SM and ME. SM and ME use dsc as follows:

ul.li: On SM all the records are stored in this namespace.
On ME any record that is not assigned to other namespaces is stored in this namespace.

section.p: Two-way XDR replication is automatically enabled for this namespace by configuring the topology.spssite.matesite parameter between the two ME sites or two SM sites.
Only ME uses it. This namesapce stores the records provisioned by SM that are not subscriber related (that is, service definition data).
XDR cannot be enabled for this namespace.
Only ME uses it. This namespace stores N-way replicated records (that is, global mapping tables).
N-way XDR replication across all MEs is automatically enabled for this namespace by configuring the topology.spssite.id parameter for MEs.
Only ME uses one or several namespaces for the partitions data. These namespaces store subscriber/devices related data.

Two-way XDR replication is automatically enabled for each of these namespaces by configuring the topology.spspartition.siteids parameter between the two MEs associated with the partition. This type of deployment has one restriction which is that A CNF can only have one partition (that is, there is one and only one topology.spspartition.siteids that contains this CNF's spssiteid)
SM and ME use it. This namespace stores all the transactions' undo logs information that is used to revert a transaction if a rollback occurs.
This is a memory only namespace.
XDR cannot be enabled for this namespace.

Aerospike namespace parameters
Aerospike namespaceâ€™s filesize and memorysize parameters are configured in accordance with the following:
The filesize and memorysize parameters defined for a specified namespace correlate.
The values for the memorysize parameters must be defined and cannot be empty.
The values for the filesize are optional.
You must update these parameters for a live deployment.
You must contact Nokia Professional Services to determine the correct values for these parameters.
